FuncDef:
The ptp port-type command sets a clock mode for a TCandBC device.
The undo ptp port-type command deletes the configured 1588v2 clock mode for a TCandBC device.
No 1588v2 clock mode is set by default.

ParaDef.Info:
Configures a TCandBC interface to work as a TC.
-

Configures a TCandBC interface to work as a BC.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
A TCandBC device combines the advantages of both a TC and a BC. The TCandBC device uses TC interfaces and BC interfaces to communicate with other 1588v2 devices. A TCandBC independently transmits 1588v2 packets between 1588v2 domains.
The undo ptp port-type command must be run to specify TC and BC interfaces on the device that is configured as a TCandBC before the interfaces support 1588v2 functions.
BC interface: sends and receives PTP messages to determine the synchronization hierarchy. Specifically, a BC interface can function as a master clock to distribute clock synchronization information to downstream devices and at the same time can function as a slave clock to receive clock synchronization information from upstream devices.TC interface: forwards PTP packets and corrects time in PTP event messages. TC interfaces do not participate in BMC source selection, and therefore do not determine the master/slave hierarchy.
This command applies only to 1588v2 and SMPTE-2059-2.

Prerequisites
The device has been configured as a TCandBC using the ptp device-type tcandbc command.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
